panels.title: Firing alerts

panels.description: You might have an SLA to serve 95% of requests within 100ms. In that case, configure a histogram to have a bucket with an upper limit of 0.3 seconds. You can then directly express the relative amount of requests served within 300ms and easily alert if the value drops below 0.95.
panels.title: Percentage of requests with response time less than 100ms

panels.description: This time, you do not want to display the percentage of requests served within 300ms, but instead the 95th percentile, i.e. the request duration within which you have served 95% of requests. To do that, you can either configure a summary with a 0.95-quantile and (for example) a 5-minute decay time, or you configure a histogram with a few buckets around the 300ms mark
panels.title: Request duration within which Alertmonitor has served N% of requests
